Articles.Content:
after that gene kerman was bored with this purple rocks from eve, he decided to send something to jool, but despite the low funds it can't be a kerbal, so wherner von kerman decided to send a probe to jool and laythe

Modes and rules:

easy (10 pt): a simple probe core to jool and a lander for laythe

medium (20 pt): an orbiter with science and a lander with science for laythe, also the probe + lander should have a max wheigt of 10 tons and cost less than 30000

hard (40 pt): an orbiter with science for jool and a lander with science for laythe, that has to get to land, not to ocean. probe + lander should have a wheigth of 5 tons and cost less than 18000 and should give at least 20 mits of data

impossible (80 pt): an orbiter for jool, that should have an orbital inlination of at least in betwen 60 and 75 degres, and a lander for the south pole of laythe that should get into the ice caps, probe + lander should have a wheigth of 7 tons and cost a max of 25000and should give at least 60 mits of data

bonus (40 - 100 pt): something that breaks the impossible will give bonus points depending on how it superates

More rules:

  • the launcher should be a real one (replica)
  • the mods aren't allowed. at least are only visual mods
  • after the launch aren't allowed revert flight, so set up your difficulty settings
  • a mistake or accident will remove you 1 - 5 points depending on how hard it is
  • images of all phases are required

also here are the position where should be jool for the transer (a bit of help)

i give all you luck

also i'll make soon flags to reconiassance that you made the challenge

Edited July 31, 2017 by Spaceman17

Cool challenge!  However, not many people are going to attempt it with the parts restricted to 0.90, that's a very old version of KSP.  It would prohibit necessary parts like a relay antenna for the orbiter, fairings for literally any replica launch vehicle, and a heat shield for the landing probe...
Yep. Interesting but parts from version 0.90 just completely ruins it...
well version is now at 1.2.0, not newer or older

the rocket Cassini-Huygens launched on was a Titan IV

so this:

well, but for don't make it too much limited i let you use any real launcher

you can but you only can use the parts of 1.2.0 to 1.2.9

There are no new parts in 1.3 exept fo one, that would find no use in this mission,
well no part restriction then, when you are ready for the challenge say me
